sentences.en: As far as wild animals and plants on the edge of extinction goes, we may not entirely believe in a reprieve but it would be inhuman of us not to try for one.
sentences.cn: 在野生动植物走向灭绝的今天，我们可能不会完全相信暂时的解救措施，但是如果我们不进行尝试的话，那就是不人道。

sentences.en: As for my unlikely allies, I think that I shall allow them a reprieve.
sentences.cn: 至于我的盟友们，我想我应该给他们一个缓刑的机会。

sentences.en: Even this extra minute was a reprieve.
sentences.cn: 就这样多拖延一分钟也好象是一种缓刑.

sentences.en: Fourteen people, waiting to be hanged for the murder of a former prime minister, have been reprieved.
sentences.cn: 因谋杀前总理而等受绞刑的十四个人获得缓刑。

sentences.en: He was condemned to death with a two - year's reprieve to test his behaviour.
sentences.cn: 他被判处死刑,缓刑两年,以观后效.

sentences.en: He was saved from the gallows by a lastminute reprieve.
sentences.cn: 最后一刻的缓刑令把他从绞架上解救了下来.

sentences.en: It looked as though the college would have to shut, but this week it was given a reprieve.
sentences.cn: 这所大学看起来要关闭了，但这周情况暂时有所缓解。

sentences.en: That past weeks had been an unexpected brief reprieve.
sentences.cn: 过去的几星期不过是出乎意外的苟延残喘.

sentences.en: The criminal won his reprieve at the eleventh hour.
sentences.cn: 罪犯在最后的关头获得缓刑.

sentences.en: The family have won a temporary reprieve from eviction.
sentences.cn: 这个家庭暂时免于被逐出.

sentences.en: The judge pronounced to reprieve a condemned prisoner
sentences.cn: 法官宣布缓期执行被判罪囚犯的刑罚。

sentences.en: The news from Saarland was an unexpected reprieve for the CDU.
sentences.cn: 然而,从萨尔兰州传来的消息却意外的给了CDU当头一棒.

sentences.en: The periodic table would appear thus to have won a temporary reprieve.
sentences.cn: 元素周期表的修改貌似要减缓咯.

sentences.en: The prisoner won a last - minute reprieve.
sentences.cn: 那囚犯在临刑前获得了缓刑.

sentences.en: Then a last - minute reprieve in the jagged shape of a lightening flash across the sky.
sentences.cn: 出发前的最后一分钟来了特赦令——天空中闪过一道锯齿状的闪电.

sentences.en: These considerations , of themselves very powerful , induced the spectatorsapprehend the possibility of a reprieve to him.
sentences.cn: 这些猜测颇有分量, 使观众不由不预料到他有可能得到缓刑.

sentences.en: Unless there is a reprieve the condemned man will hang on Friday.
sentences.cn: 除非缓刑,那个被宣判的人将于星期五被处绞刑.

sentences.en: You will be converted—you will be converted just as soon as every effort to compass pardon, commutation, or reprieve HAS failed—and then!
sentences.cn: 您会痛悔前非——就在人们为您恳求赦免、申请减刑、或改判缓刑的一切努力统告失败的时候，您会痛悔前非的。

trans.tran_en: a delay before something bad happens or continues to happen
a delay before something bad happens or continues to happen
to officially stop a prisoner from being killed as a punishment
